metadata.title: CVE-2020-7238 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Netty 4.1.43.Final allows HTTP Request Smuggling because it mishandlesTransfer-Encoding whitespace (such as a [space]Transfer-Encoding:chunkedline) and a later Content-Length header. This issue exists because of anincomplete fix for CVE-2019-16869.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-7238` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetty-java - 1:3.2.6.Final-2+deb8u2build0.14.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: netty package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.2.6.Final-2+deb8u2build0.14.04.1~esm1').
